moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nc3 Nc6 3. Nf3 d6: Another blitz game!  Sometimes I play the open variation and sometimes closed and sometimes it is really a Kings Indian Attack variation.
moves.4. d3 Nf6 5. g3 e6 6. Bg2 Be7: Black is solid and white wants to develop his DSB without the reply Ng4 so ...
moves.7. O-O Bd7 8. h3 Qc7 9. Be3: Black should castle here or soon but he decides to prevent Nb5 and expand on the Queen's wing.
moves.9... a6 10. d4: So white decides to open the center.
moves.10... cxd4 11. Nxd4 h6 12. Qe2 b5 13. a3: White prevented the expansion but black sees a good post for his knight.
moves.13... Rc8 14. f4 Na5 15. Rad1 Nc4: Black has a nice tactical shot but it will leave him exposed in the center.
moves.16. Bc1 Nxa3: If white plays bxa3 then black captures the knight on c3.  But white has a better reply.
moves.17. e5 dxe5 18. fxe5: If Black plays Nd5 the white exchanges the knights and then captures on a3 getting a significant material advantage.  So black must retreat the knight and this traps his king the center.
moves.18... Ng8 19. Qf3: Guarding the pawn on f7 is not possible.  Black should probably have retreated the knight to h7 so he castle and survive.
moves.19... f6: This stops the threat to f7 but there are other possibilities now.
moves.20. Qh5+: Black must play 21. ..., Kf8 here after which the complications from 22. Nd5 are hard for me to calculate but that was the plan. ( Qxe5 is not possible as QxQ wins the queenas the f pawn would be pinned ) After other moves exf6 looks tough and 22. ..., exd5 if followed by 23. Bxd5 with the threat of mate on f7 and I don't see a good way to stop it since 23. ..., Be8 allows Nxe6 mate.  Please help me out if you see other options.
moves.20... Kd8 21. Nxe6#: Black went the wrong way but I think he was in trouble anyway.
